content.description: To date the most core of the gap routes. Good rock and stimulating & creative climbing make this an extremely rewarding route. Falling on this route as with all gap routes is definately not in your best interest. Completeing any of these routes is extremely rewarding but this one is super rewarding.
content.protection: Standard alpine rack of nuts, cams, & selection of pins
content.location: The route begins at the obvious steep gash in the center of the north face of the gap. Two to three steep pitches reveals an amazing belay ledge slightly to the right underneath an overhanging jam crack. To decend all routes, but glisade down the large recess to the climbers right of the routes. This brings you right to the road! Very nice.

content.description: It's fun and easy. You can make this route a little more difficult by taking the steepest line, or you can make it easy and skirt around the harder stuff. Staying to the right of the ridge will generally keep you in the more exciting terrain versus the easier left side. Simul climbing the route will significantly speed things up as a lot of the route is low 5th class and finishes on 4th class. Just make it up as you go!
content.protection: A single rack and set of nuts is plenty adequate. All gear anchors, so get creative while looking for good rock.
content.location: This route climbs the obvious ridge as you enter the gap from the east (freeway side). Park in any of the pullouts before you enter the gap and cross the stream to hike up to the base of the ridge. Start in a low angle left facing corner.

content.description: One of the classics; if not the funnest of the Gap routes. A few mixed pitches brings one to the midsdle of the prominent prow in the center of the face. Climb steep 5.7 jugs(mixed) for a couple pitches and finish on easy mixed terrian which puts you right on the summit. Exposed, fun and as with all gap routes, unique.
content.protection: standard alpine rack, all belays are natural.
content.location: Start at the base of the central coulior and climb approx 250ft up to a point where it looks like fun to traverse right to gain the main rib on the north face; climb up!

content.description: Located to the right(west) of the ice climb is a steep pyramid of rock approx 350ft tall; the Aiguille traverses in from thewest on mod snow and ascends the center of the pyramid. From the top of this a couple of easy mixed pitches leads to a short section of WI 3 ice. At the top another pitch of moderate mixed brings one to the big arching roof which is approx. 35ft long. Traverse into the roof and acrross through some intense traditional mixed climbing (M6+). a short pitch of moderate mixed brings one to the summit. A super classic route anywhere!
content.protection: Standard rack; doubles .5-# 3 BD, selection of pins
content.location: Center of steep rock pyramid; west of ice route
